full_text:
#nflverse
Do NFL win probability (WP) streams move too much (with respect to Bayesian updating)?
I applied tests put forward in a 2020 Augenblick and Rabin paper to @nflfastR's vegas-informed WP model. By their tests, on average, no.
https://t.co/xQ1sHGqC8z
@benbbaldwin @Stat_Ron

#NFL Week 6 EPA Rankings for Offense. #Jets rushing attack now up to fifthğŸ‘€ 

#nflverse https://t.co/an52ctSkNr
Wow, look at the jump in pass EPA/play when you only include Zach Wilson's starts this yearğŸ˜§ #Jets #nflverse https://t.co/t28Ljgqp7b https://t.co/PaFRzoSZpk

Now, after 7 weeks, the #Jets rank counting only ZW starts.

Zach Wilson takes this offense from bad with Flacco to middle of the pack (or better if he improves).

#nflverse https://t.co/ypMhdR4uQN

The #Giants rank at the top of the league in 10+ yard runs, but at the bottom of the league in 15+ yard passes

#NFLVerse https://t.co/kOC5KrmvCf
#nflverse https://t.co/wCK2COyICn

Inpredict is a valuable resource for determining market signal, but it should not be the exclusive source. Courtesy of @deepvaluebettor's elite dataviz, here is a more holistic view, through 6 weeks, of where the broader market stands on each team. 
#nflverse https://t.co/LPH6Z7NzYg

Updated Drive Quality on scripted plays vs non scripted through week 6. Can't make up this SF,LAR, GB cluster. 
#nflverse https://t.co/ReQ56TPEZ5

#Steelers marks in Week 7 in terms of YAC and EPA. 

Data indicating that George Pickens does not have a lot of separation but certainly generates value when ball is in his hands. Similar to Freiermuth.

#nflverse https://t.co/m08b8RFJnE

Redoing this viz for #NFL QBs given we have a decent sample size of data to work with now.

We can see how QBs are tracking based on their cumulative EPA through the first six weeks.

Unfamiliar territory for one QB on that bottom row... ğŸ‘€

#nflverse https://t.co/SkIs2KPy9J

ğ——ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—°ğ—®ğ—½ from #thursdaynightfootball.

This viz is still a work in progress, but thought I'd share an update following some additions.

Was intrigued with the Eckel discussion online recently, so have attempted to add some of this data in the viz.

#nflverse https://t.co/jde7nsYI16

Thought I'd knock this same plot out for the #NFL ğ—¿ğ˜‚ğ—»ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¯ğ—®ğ—°ğ—¸ğ˜€ while I was at it.

Players with a â¬†ï¸ ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—ºğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ˜ƒğ—² ğ—˜ğ—£ğ—” are shown in the top rows.

Chubb and Jacobs the clear standouts, and its a massive shame about Breece Hall.

#nflverse #NFLTwitter https://t.co/yS0udZxw5P https://t.co/o9Q6zmGioG

I'm sharing my passion for data analytics via daily #fantasyfootball insights derived from SQL, Python and #nflverse. See thread ğŸ‘‡ and check out my GitHub for the source code. https://t.co/myFoCU1hvm

Day 2 (2/2): I expected more variance between players (especially at WR since they catch more passes), but the very top performers seem to be the best regardless of scoring system used.
#100daysofcoding #nflverse

Updated after Week 6: Relative team efficiencies, constructed using a blend of z-score standardized EPA/P and SR%

Data is from early downs, opponent adjusted, turnovers are excluded, garbage time is excluded

#nflverse https://t.co/mqgBO2imz4

Updated after Week 7: Relative team efficiencies, constructed using a blend of z-score standardized EPA/P and SR%

Data is from early downs, opponent adjusted, turnovers are excluded, garbage time is excluded

#nflverse https://t.co/tXBtnDTFlb

It's week 7 of the #NFL season, so let's check in on my model's latest forecast

Following the @Steelers surprising win over @Buccaneers, my model adjusted Pittsburgh up and out of the lead position for the number 1 pick.  I guess that's good? #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/2RBgdVK3Tm

From a strength perspective, @BuffaloBills are creating separation from the rest of the league, which is even more impressive when you remember that my model doesn't consider wins and losses in its strength algorithm.  The @Eagles climb back on top in the NFC #nflverse https://t.co/YWW3S8scSb

That's it for our tangent - onto the weekly predictions. Biggest surprise of the week?  @49ers over the @Chiefs at home by 1.  I probably wouldn't bet on it...

As always, I welcome questions and comments
 #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/Wmu1SzH0eX

Snaps by Formations. KC offense first. Absolutely not our best outing, averaging just 0.05 EPA/play overall. The three plays with 3 TE's on the field were very ungood. Hardman and Moore are starting to split the snaps as WR3 in 11 personnel.

#nflverse https://t.co/sQbPQt0ed8

Here's our defense. Honestly not terrible. Averaged 0.14 epa/play vs one of the best offenses in the league. The 4-2-5 was very good, and was our most common formation. 3-3-5 and 4-3-4 (base) were absolutely lit on fire though... 

#nflverse https://t.co/KujDVLA2qf

Here's Buffalo's numbers. Their offense averaged 0.14 (compared to our 0.05) epa/play. They were very successful in 21 and 12 personnel. Their D was good in 3-3-5, and solid in 2-3-6. 

#nflverse https://t.co/9PzR2DMPSR

Boring games and low scores ... Blame to low passing epa/play

#nflverse https://t.co/48eB8Fpwc2

Nice for the NFL to leave a 45 minute break for Sunday dinner, I suppose.

#nflverse https://t.co/30xQqFf4O9

Yesterday's NFL schedule viz!

#nflverse https://t.co/cSZ7WbYC9Y

Plus, the new absolute gel edition, that highlights close games via absolute score difference and also gel electrophoresis!

#nflverse https://t.co/yyFtkO2wNJ

NFL division records excluding divisional games through seven weeks. Eagles at 6-0 somehow can't get any breathing room in the NFC East, who have won 84% of their non-divisional matchups so far. NFC East and AFC East beating up on the rest of the league #nflverse https://t.co/yzju6elgWX

Day 3: For the 2020 season, which teams were the worst in terms of avg points scored against them at home? I did this in #SQL using CTEs, window functions and the incredible #nflverse dataset. Tomorrow I'll try to find teams that show up on this list for multiple seasons! https://t.co/8JENuLdYBN

Rookie snap count leaderboards! After some discussion the last couple weeks, I've decided that this chart will show ALL rookies (drafted and UDFA's), but only counts those rookies who have gotten real offensive or defensive snaps (no special teams). 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/g00i0oUY5D

Pass Rush Preview, KC @ SF edition. Offenses vs the blitz. Chiefs still being blitzed less often than average, and finding success vs them. SF has had incredible success vs the blitz on first downs. 11 personnel is both teams money formation against the blitz.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/oxyVVnge9i

Here's the defenses. Chiefs are solid but not spectacular when blitzing. They should...uhhh...maybe not blitz on second downs? Niners are solid across the board, and blitz just under average amount of times. Also, the niners basically only run two defenses?? 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/CpdbmseBdX

It's week 7 of the #NFL season, so let's check in on my model's latest forecast

Following the @Steelers surprising win over @Buccaneers, my model adjusted Pittsburgh up and out of the lead position for the number 1 pick.  I guess that's good? #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/2RBgdVK3Tm

From a strength perspective, @BuffaloBills are creating separation from the rest of the league, which is even more impressive when you remember that my model doesn't consider wins and losses in its strength algorithm.  The @Eagles climb back on top in the NFC #nflverse https://t.co/YWW3S8scSb

That's it for our tangent - onto the weekly predictions. Biggest surprise of the week?  @49ers over the @Chiefs at home by 1.  I probably wouldn't bet on it...

As always, I welcome questions and comments
 #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/Wmu1SzH0eX

Pass Rush Preview, KC @ SF edition. Offenses vs the blitz. Chiefs still being blitzed less often than average, and finding success vs them. SF has had incredible success vs the blitz on first downs. 11 personnel is both teams money formation against the blitz.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/oxyVVnge9i

Here's the defenses. Chiefs are solid but not spectacular when blitzing. They should...uhhh...maybe not blitz on second downs? Niners are solid across the board, and blitz just under average amount of times. Also, the niners basically only run two defenses??

Do NFL win probability (WP) streams move too much (with respect to Bayesian updating)?
I applied tests put forward in a 2020 Augenblick and Rabin paper to @nflfastR's vegas-informed WP model. By their tests, on average, no.
https://t.co/xQ1sHGqC8z
